de.dimensionv.android.widget.dashboardlayout

Class SimpleDashboardItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dimensionv.android.widget.dashboardlayout.SimpleDashboardItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    View.OnClickListener, DashboardItem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContainerDashboardItem

    public class SimpleDashboardItem
extends Object
implements DashboardItem
    A simple DashboardItem implementation that can be used out of the box to fill a DashboardLayout. It can also be extended for more complex DashboardItems while maintaining the benefits of this class's implementation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.dimensionv.android.widget.dashboardlayout.DashboardItem

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleDashboardItem

        public SimpleDashboardItem(long id,
                   String text,
                   Drawable iconEnabled,
                   Drawable iconDisabled)

        Creates a new ContainerDashboardItem from the given parameters.

        This constructor creates the item as "enabled", which means it will be active and clickable.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID of this item (required for later identification when an item gets clicked upon).
        text - The text the should show up under the icon in the dashboard.
        iconEnabled - The icon for the enabled == true state.
        iconDisabled - The icon for the enabled == false state.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • SimpleDashboardItem

        public SimpleDashboardItem(long id,
                   String text,
                   Drawable iconEnabled,
                   Drawable iconDisabled,
                   boolean enabled)

        Creates a new ContainerDashboardItem from the given parameters.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID of this item (required for later identification when an item gets clicked upon).
        text - The text the should show up under the icon in the dashboard.
        iconEnabled - The icon for the enabled == true state.
        iconDisabled - The icon for the enabled == false state.
        enabled - The state that defines whether the item is active and clickable (true) or not (false).
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • getIconDrawable

        public Drawable getIconDrawable()
        Description copied from interface: DashboardItem
        Returns the drawable object of the item. This can be either an icon or some other kind of graphical representation. If necessary, this method has to check the enabled-state in order to return the appropriate drawable object. In most cases, this can probably be omitted, because the underlying button-object that is the actual dashboard-element on the GUI will take care of a disabled looks.
        Specified by:
        getIconDrawable in interface DashboardItem
        Returns:
        The item's drawable object

      • setIconEnabled

        protected void setIconEnabled(Drawable icon)
        Sets the icon for the enabled state.
        Parameters:
        icon - The icon to be displayed when the DashboardItem is enabled.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • getText

        public CharSequence getText()
        Description copied from interface: DashboardItem
        Returns the text to be displayed under the drawable object returned by the getIconDrawable() method. (Think of it as a name/label)
        Specified by:
        getText in interface DashboardItem
        Returns:
        The item's label

      • getID

        public long getID()
        Description copied from interface: DashboardItem
        Returns the ID associated with the item. It's the items unique identifier, and you are free to use any kind of number best suited to your case.

        Please note: this ID will be used as the actual button's ID by a cast to int.

        Specified by:
        getID in interface DashboardItem
        Returns:
        the item' ID.

      • setID

        protected void setID(long id)
        Sets the ID of this DashboardItem.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean state)
        Description copied from interface: DashboardItem
        Sets the state of the DashboardItem. The state can be either true, which means the item is enabled (active and clickable), or false, which means the item is disabled (neither active nor clickable).
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in interface DashboardItem
        Parameters:
        state - true for enabled, false for disabled state.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: DashboardItem
        Returns the current state of the DashboardItem. true for an enabled state, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface DashboardItem
        Returns:
        true for enabled, false for disabled state.
        See Also:
        DashboardItem.setEnabled(boolean)
